Major William Cage.Action: Acknowledges his fear and young age openly, visibly stressed but tries to cope with it.
Interacts with fellow soldiers in a nervous, earnest way, showing shared vulnerability.
Is terrified, gasping for breath, showing visible fear before the drop.
Wears powered armor and follows commands under stressful conditions.
Trembles in fear and admits nervousness before the drop
Looks unreassured despite a comrade’s attempt to boost morale
Unable to jump from the dropship whereas others fail too
Screams and flails while falling from the dropship, then quickly staggers up and scans for friendlies despite shock and chaos.
Stares in shock at a dying soldier stuck under the burning dropship without immediate action.
Screams, hits release, and tumbles out of the dropship when it is struck and spinning out of control.
Flails and kicks during free fall but successfully activates his jacket's autoland jets in the last second to cushion his fall and avoid injury.
Staggers up from the landing, manages to clear sand from his faceplate and immediately assesses terrain and friendlies via his heads-up display.
Stares in shock at the burning dropship and dying soldier instead of immediately acting.
Runs clumsily with YONABURU to join company under heavy fire, tries to get bearings quickly.
Expresses mounting horror and despair about overwhelming enemy forces.
Clumsily runs to join his company on a chaotic battlefield, struggling with the exojacket and tumbling into the trench amid heavy enemy fire.
Attempts to get his bearings quickly during intense enemy fire, observing enemy movements on his heads-up display.
Frozen to the spot, trembling, unable to move during the Mimic attack.
Freezes in place, trembling and unable to move during intense combat.
Attempts to aim and engage the enemy alongside a fellow soldier despite overwhelming odds.
Lifts weapon shaking, trying to pick a target under heavy fire, shows human fear but attempts to engage.
No indication of hostility or aggression toward teammates; shares the dire situation with Yonaburu.
Fails to take any hostile action against allies, showing tacit trust and reliance on team support.
Deserts the battlefield and runs away from the fight, fleeing from danger while comrades fight.
Runs away from the battlefield, deserting while comrades engage in combat.
Blindly hauls ass for the sea cliffs, showing panic and lack of tactical awareness.
Drags Yonaburu to safety despite danger, fights wildly to protect himself and ally.
Moments of panic and self-preservation expressed (e.g., 'I don't care! LET ME GO!').
Struggles to defend himself against mimics despite injury and low ammo, showing determination to survive.
Screams in desperation when out of ammo and facing death.
Receives help from Rita Vrataski, but does not resist or reject her aid, showing no hostility.
Struggles to lift his weapon but has no ammo left, causing a moment of helplessness and panic when facing approaching enemies.
Screams for help when threatened by Mimics, showing vulnerability but also realistic fear in a dire situation.
Is rescued unexpectedly by Rita Vrataski who kills the attacking Mimics quickly.
Acknowledges his impending death with vulnerability, admits he doesn't want to die, and expresses apology to a fallen comrade (Yonaburu).
Bitterly tells Rita to 'fuck off' when she leaves him to go back to battle.
Offers his fresh battery to Rita despite his own dire condition, showing selflessness but also practical understanding of the situation.
Trembles, coughs up blood, cries, and expresses fear of dying, showing vulnerability and lack of composed confidence.
Despite physical pain and near death, attempts to crawl to Yonaburu's side and apologizes, showing some persistence and emotional awareness but limited physical capability.
Freezes completely when a Mimic stands over him, displaying helplessness and inability to respond to an immediate threat.
Grabs a pistol and fires repeatedly at a dangerous mimic to protect others despite severe personal harm.
Grabs the pistol from the mud and fires accurately into a vulnerable spot on the mimic, causing significant damage and misfiring its weapon.
Shuts his eyes and squeezes the trigger under intense pressure and pain.
Screams in agony and seems overwhelmed by the pain and burning caused by the mimic's tendrils.
Shuts down Nance's teasing with 'Shut up, Nance.' in a brief, somewhat curt exchange.
Defaces a recruitment poster with rude graffiti, mocking the image of Rita Vrataski and the army message.
Appears disoriented and confused in the barracks, uncertain about recent events and battle preparation.
Attempts to cover up his confusion by making a weak excuse about having a nightmare.
Shows mild self-awareness about his physical condition (headache, shaking hands) and acknowledges need to stop drinking excessively.
Expresses worry and distraction about Yonaburu's plan and mission details, showing concern for the safety and seriousness of the situation.
Chides Ford for gambling after tough physical training, indicating concern for comrades' well-being and discipline.
Looks worried and distracted when discussing the mission plan and expresses a strange feeling of déjà vu about events happening.
Tries to enforce discipline by telling Ford not to make soldiers do PT again after a hard day, showing some concern for troop welfare but without effective command presence.
Attempts to defend a fellow soldier (Kimmel) who is reprimanded; expresses concern by saying 'Dude, he came RIGHT through that door, and —'
Quickly alerts others about an unexpected threat ('Dude, he came RIGHT through that door').
His eyes go wide after being slapped on the back of the head, indicating surprise or lack of control.
Stares stunned without taking action or showing leadership during Sergeant Farell's harsh speech and muster.
Engages with fellow soldier Yonaburu, tries to share his experience and interpret the strange deja vu phenomenon openly.
Describes the suffering of fellow soldiers (Kimmel, Nance, Ford) empathically during the obstacle course.
Attempts to recall and predict upcoming training events based on his memories of the future, showing an effort to understand and anticipate situations.
Appears dazed, sweating, and confused during physical training, indicating a lack of readiness and confidence in a military environment.
Narrates the fight in a casual, humorous way, making light of others' misfortune.
Stops narrating upon seeing Rita enter, showing respect or recognition of authority.
Does not intervene directly in the fight, merely observes and comments.
Keeps his eyes on Rita despite being in physical pain and discomfort; tries to avoid direct confrontation by looking at the ground when noticed.
Honest and straightforwardly denies having a dream about Rita, showing sincerity.
Appears troubled and perhaps confused about the situation when discussing the dream, revealing vulnerability.
Hesitates about joining comrades for a social raid, shows reluctance but not outright refusal.
Cage is shaking and ultimately drops during the iso-pushup challenge, showing physical struggle and lack of confidence.
Answers Yonaburu truthfully and clearly about his mental state and the situation with Rita, indicating self-awareness.
Appears troubled and uncertain about his own mental state and situation, demonstrating insecurity.
Expresses doubt about participating in the platoon's liquor raid ritual, suggesting indecision.
Does not argue against joining the ritual of drinking before battle despite uncertainty.
Passive acceptance of the group's behavior, does not challenge or distance himself from camaraderie.
Questions the tradition of drinking before battle by pointing out they've never been in a battle.
Helps the drunken Yonaburu to his bunk after he is sick.
Comforts Yonaburu by agreeing he survived in a dream, giving hope.
Sits off by himself, away from others, drinking hesitantly.
Helps drunk Yonaburu to his bunk, showing presence of mind and care for a fellow soldier.
Sits off by himself, staring out at the breakers, seeming detached or preoccupied rather than actively engaging with the situation.
Picks up Yonaburu's dropped photo and calmly responds to his drunken ramblings, showing emotional awareness and steadiness.
Hesitates briefly before drinking offered alcohol, showing some uncertainty or internal conflict.
Appears anxious and heavily loaded with gear, soldiers laugh at him.
Equips himself heavily with extra ammo, grenades, and many guns, indicating preparation.
Appears anxious and overwhelmed despite preparation.
Waves his arms frantically to warn fellow soldiers of the incoming dropship crash, giving them a chance to look up.
Drops from the ship first, acting out of fear and self-preservation rather than looking out for others first.
Hits his release early and jumps from the dropship without waiting for orders or full preparation.
Waves arms frantically to warn soldiers of impending dropship crash, giving them a moment to look up and avoid immediate death.
Waves his arms frantically to warn soldiers of incoming dropship, giving them enough time to react.
Runs away from the fight after Roker is killed; does not stay to support comrades.
Wriggles free after Yonaburu tackles him and commands to let him go.
Waves his arms frantically to warn soldiers of incoming danger, giving them enough time to look up before a dropship crash.
Runs away blindly from the battle, leaving comrades behind including soldiers in danger and under fire.
Responds to Jonaburu's call quickly and gets to the trench despite being dazed.
Crawls away after being tackled and wriggles free from Yonaburu who tries to prevent him from fleeing.
Kicks Yonaburu out of the line of fire to save him from a javelin attack.
Smiles and laughs after saving Yonaburu, sincerely expressing that he saved him.
Asks Yonaburu for help after waking up scared and vulnerable in the barracks.
Explains the situation to Yonaburu, tries to get help, shows emotional vulnerability and some confusion.
Admits to running from danger and shows signs of stress and physical discomfort.
Displays determination to convince others despite being in a fragile mental state.
Tackles Yonaburu when feeling betrayed and desperate.
Freaks out and knocks away the hypo gun, preventing injection but causes harm to the medic.
Knocks off restraints and escapes from danger despite panic.
Tackles Yonaburu despite physical disadvantage, showing determination and courage.
Freaks out and knocks away a hypodermic needle, then quickly adapts by sawing off zip-ties and escaping.
Struggles to clearly explain his time loop experience, showing confusion and lack of confidence in communication.
Smiles down at a little girl playing on the beach and greets her kindly.
Runs away from base, abandoning platoon and duties.
Picks up the little girl and moves her to dry sand to protect her from the oily water.
Covers the little girl's eyes during the mimic attack and calls for help.
Expresses sorrow and apology before dying, indicating empathy and regret.
Apologizes to Yonaburu before attempting suicide.
Asks Yonaburu about his last day on Earth, shows concern.
Invites Yonaburu to get breakfast, attempts friendly interaction.
Chambers a bullet into a pistol and puts it to his temple, attempting suicide out of desperation.
After revival, takes aspirin and observes surroundings quietly, showing some presence of mind and endurance.
Asks a reflective question to Yonaburu about what to do if today was their last day on Earth, showing some introspection but not strategic thinking.
Offers to get breakfast despite Yonaburu's focus on strategy, showing lack of understanding of the situation's gravity.
Walks through the barracks lost in thought, observing others but not taking action.
Asks the kitchen girl for a pen and tries to explain his bizarre situation politely despite his odd behavior.
Eats alone, avoids eye contact with a dog giving him a deadly look, shows social discomfort.
Writes down the number of times he has died to keep track, showing awareness and planning.
Eats alone and avoids eye contact with hostile soldiers, indicating social discomfort and lack of confidence.
Asks directions to the holovid library, showing willingness to seek information and learn.
Uses the bitter, low-quality coffee despite dislike, indicating adaptability to adverse conditions.
Reflects on past memories about satellites with a calm, thoughtful tone.
Provides concise voiceover narration summarizing the military’s attempts to communicate and combat the alien threat.
Narrates the threat of Mimics and the danger they pose, showing awareness and concern for the people affected.
Provides a clear, concise explanation about the Mimics’ behavior and evolution, demonstrating awareness of enemy tactics and adaptability.
Narrates detailed observations about the Mimics' capabilities and mimicry, indicating analytical skill and understanding of the threat.
Powers down cheetos watching holovid, staying up all night, praying to avoid service.
Admits to being scared and out of place among soldiers preparing for battle.
Shows a realistic understanding of the war and its stakes, reflecting a sincere internal perspective.
Attempts to engage with Yonaburu and his group, but declines their invitation politely ('Maybe next time').
Reflects alone in the locker room, appearing isolated and possibly burdened by fear and doubt.
Opens up to Sgt. Farell about his fear of certain death and vulnerability, showing sincerity and trust.
Shows little direct hostility or contempt towards others despite being called a 'dick' and doubted by peers.
Asks tough questions that challenge superiors and show willingness to engage critically.
Refuses to participate in the liquor raid night before battle, suggesting avoidance or lack of team bonding.
Expresses fear and self-doubt openly, acknowledging he is not a good soldier.
Considers and reflects deeply on the reality of battle and death, showing self-awareness and thoughtfulness.
Wanders alone in a gloomy locker room staring at empty exojacket, possibly showing hesitation or feeling overwhelmed.
Tries hard during sparring despite repeatedly failing and being knocked down.
Responds respectfully and attentively to Sgt. Farell's tough coaching.
Struggles initially in sparring, repeatedly getting hit and knocked down by Sergeant Farell, showing poor combat skill and timing.
Persists through repeated failures in training, keeps trying despite getting overwhelmed.
Finally lands a successful blow on Farell after repeated attempts.
Listens to Farell's advice about trusting instincts and the jacket rather than overthinking, showing openness to learning.
Shakes his jacketed hand nervously before the jump.
Shoves a terrified soldier out of the dropship to force him to jump despite fear.
Tackles a happy soldier out of harm's way during landing, effectively saving him.
Leads the soldiers across the beach with urgency, showing initiative and command under pressure.
Moves past terrified comrades to take charge and suggests a tactical retreat to the canyon, showing leadership and concern for survival.
Tells Yonaburu to stay with him, encouraging comrades to stick together.
Fires on the mimic to protect fellow soldiers, leading by example.
Warns Sgt. Farell about the imminent mimic overrun and suggests an escape route through a canyon, convincing Sgt. Farell to follow his lead.
Leads soldiers in retreat and shows quick decision making by firing on an approaching mimic runner and engaging in effective hand-to-hand combat when attacked.
Warns Kimmel about the Sergeant's arrival to help him prepare.
Attempts to organize a surprise party for Sgt. Farell.
Intercepts Sgt. Farell to communicate the party plans despite the Sergeant's scowl.
Sings behind the shocked Sergeant, breaking the tension with a friendly gesture.
Encourages Kimmel by acknowledging his skill improvement and engaging with him about his gaming experience.
Takes initiative to prepare the soldiers for Sgt. Farell's arrival by warning them and trying to organize the room.
Attempts to waylay Sgt. Farell to deliver information but is physically pushed aside.
Steps into a tense situation and begins singing after the sergeant is brought up short, potentially defusing tension or showing confidence in an unconventional way.
Tells others to 'give it a rest' when they mock Rita's sexual behavior, defends her by saying she is better than them.
Admits quietly that Rita is still the best despite his previous criticisms.
Engages in lighthearted banter with peers, showing openness to conversation even when teased about abilities.
Smiles when joking with peers, showing friendly disposition.
Pushes the platoon forward despite heavy danger, firing to protect comrades.
Leaps to help Yonaburu by firing to save him from a mimic attack.
Engages in relentless hand-to-hand combat with Farell, showing determination but not expressing friendliness or kindness.
Fights back relentlessly against Sgt. Farell's beating and takes on a mimic in brutal hand-to-hand combat, showing determination despite injuries.
Watches Rita fight mimics closely, showing some interest or concern, but does not intervene immediately.
Fires to save Yonaburu when he is attacked by the aquatic Mimic.
Expresses admiration for Rita's combat abilities.
Calls Yonaburu by a nickname 'Yobo' despite Yonaburu's discomfort, insists on using it.
Engages in casual, playful interaction with Yonaburu, tries to keep life interesting by adding spices to food.
Fires at the aquatic Mimic immediately after it attacks Yonaburu.
Notices the grenade rolling under Yonaburu's ass and warns him urgently.
Frequently asks for the time during the battle, indicating situational awareness and timing considerations.
Piles every imaginable variety of unappetizing food on his plate and adds salt, sugar, spices to break monotony.
Gives Yonaburu a nickname despite his protests, showing a casual or informal demeanor in serious situations.
Writes '93 - KIA 2:32' on his hand, indicating an awareness of casualties and likely attempting to keep track or make note of important battlefield information.
Pushes back when provoked by Heeler after being pushed first.
Observes Rita's holovid carefully, perceiving her loneliness and melancholy.
Pushes back Heeler after being pushed, stands up to bullying with some confidence.
Engages in physical fight but is overwhelmed due to physical disadvantages.
Studies Rita's holovid footage carefully and intently, analyzing her movements and expressions.
Shows respect and admiration for Rita by acknowledging her skill and watching her fight through old war vids.
Engages in casual conversation and accepts an apple offered by Sgt. Farell, reflecting friendly tolerance and openness.
Responds with uncertainty when asked about signing fatal documents, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Strikes the target forcefully, injures himself but persists, reacts positively and shows enthusiasm.
Leads soldiers confidently during combat, calls out 'All clear! Move out!' to coordinate team movement.
Makes a light, friendly joke about reading and asks a peer the time.
STRIKES the metal, pylon-shaped target but is thrown across the room and lands in a heap due to pain feedback; clumsy initial movements with the exo-suit.
Successfully crumples the metal target with his fist despite clumsiness.
Decimates MIMICS twice as fast and strong as before, impressing watching soldiers.
Leads men out of the canyon, showing effective command under pressure.
Makes a casual, somewhat off-topic comment about butterfly effects and weather unpredictability during a tactical movement.
Organizes an ambush and commands groups of soldiers tactically.
Shows concern and frustration when Yonaburu falls off the cliff and calls his name.
Fights fiercely and single-handedly to protect his group from mimic attack despite running out of ammo.
Organizes an ambush and motions groups of soldiers into position.
Scans the field using binoculars and questions why the expected enemy presence is absent.
Is surprised and distracted when a soldier reports a trap, underestimating the enemy’s strategy initially.
Fights back fiercely alone against an ambush, despite being outnumbered.
Runs out of ammo on primary weapons during a critical fight, which limits options against the swarm.
Quickly adapts by using the tank cannon as a bludgeon and effectively defeats remaining enemies.
Smiles evenly at the Dispensary Captain while sliding requisition orders, maintains polite interaction despite minor bureaucratic resistance.
Keeps intentions classified and somewhat vague when asked about usage, avoiding openness.
Confidently obtains a classified piece of equipment by presenting requisition orders and bluffing when questioned.
Has a clear plan and acts with calm under pressure while navigating the dispensary despite initial resistance.
Demonstrates observant internal reflection about unpredictability and patterns, showing an analytical mindset.
Catches Shasta's glasses before they hit the floor after startling her.
Watches soldiers necking and dogs fighting without intervening.
Approaches Shasta gently despite surprising her, catches her glasses before they fall.
Expresses interest in meeting Shasta in a friendly, informal manner.
Offers a useful replacement part to help Shasta avoid extra work and dealing with an annoying colleague.
Playfully teases about the overeager armory guy hitting on Shasta, showing awareness of her discomfort.
Attempts to barter with Shasta for a valuable item (axe), which may show self-interest more than warmth.
Acknowledges unusualness with a lighthearted response.
Removes weapons to 'lighten up' and adapts his fighting style.
Fights fiercely and leads the platoon against overwhelming odds.
Fights with exojacket off to avoid overloading the autobalancer.
Removes excess weapons and ordinance to lighten load and increase mobility.
Uses a huge battle axe effectively in combat, fighting like a berserker and making short work of a mimic.
Leads platoon to crest of hill despite large enemy force and unexpected appearance of a Megareaver.
Charges directly at a massive, heavily armed Megareaver.
Hacks off Megareaver's arm despite danger, rallies soldiers loudly and confidently, encouraging them to move out.
Smiles and playfully responds to Sgt. Farell's surprise at his combat skill, showing friendliness and lightheartedness.
Leads the charge against overwhelming enemy forces, fights to protect comrade Yonaburu by deflecting shots aimed at him.
Runs leading men into battle, deflecting shots aimed at comrade Yonaburu.
Responds with pain and says sorry to Yonaburu while helpless and spasming.
Yells in frustration and expresses his hopelessness about the time loop and dying repeatedly.
Addresses the platoon honestly about the inevitability of death and encourages them to use the day to be their best selves.
Smashes Kimmel's video game to get attention but does not lash out at anyone personally.
Eats alone while others talk about him nervously, showing social isolation but no hostility.
Yells in frustration and expresses despair about the repeating death loop, showing a lack of control over the situation.
Realizes and articulates the nature of the time loop he is trapped in, demonstrating awareness and understanding.
Attempts to warn and motivate the platoon to prepare for the impending battle despite their skepticism.
Smashes a video game in frustration, which is an emotional outburst and does not advance his capability or confidence.
Initiates communication and tries to organize others by sharing critical information and encouraging them to act seriously.
Admits he was probably just drunk when giving a meaningful speech, downplaying himself.
Tells Kimmel blunt, harsh truths about how others die and his criticisms (e.g. calling Kimmel 'too fat' and saying he usually drowns).
Smiles and drinks metacoffee after sharing grim realities, attempting to keep Kimmel from fighting tomorrow after previously giving an inspiring speech.
Shares detailed, brutal accounts of comrades' deaths, which could be perceived as unsympathetic or discouraging.
Calmly and bluntly informs Kimmel of the harsh realities of battle, using dark humor to prepare him mentally.
Shows detailed knowledge of fellow soldiers' typical fates and weaknesses, indicating observational skill and battlefield awareness.
Attempts to emotionally manipulate Kimmel to avoid fighting after his motivational speech.
Eats a disgusting combination of foods to 'keep it interesting,' showing a lack of discipline or self-care.
Offers whiskey to the rest of the platoon to share, despite their refusal.
Drinks whiskey alone in the howling wind, showing visible distress.
Acts recklessly, jumping and lighting a match to molotov fuel bombs, looking insane.
Hauls a Mimic up a hill and leaps into a strikejet to escape to space, showing determination to survive despite danger.
Handles Mimics aggressively without concern for larger purpose; kills without purpose, standing on a growing pile of dead Mimics.
Plays a handheld video game during the battle, showing detachment and inattentiveness to other soldiers and situation.
Responds to Rita's arrival by fighting alongside her and matching her moves, demonstrating teamwork and engagement.
Engages in banter with Rita and admits 'I play a lot of video games,' showing friendly and sincere interaction.
Shows off a complex and insane fighting move to impress Rita.
Acknowledges inability to fight like Rita and earnestly tries to improve.
Engages in cooperative fighting, forming a perfect team with Rita.
Uses sarcastic humor about his likely death after the fight.
Reacted with shock and surprise to Rita’s question, then attentive when prompted again.
Kills six mimics with a complex and skillful move, showing off for Rita.
Hammers a few mimics back but is clumsy by comparison.
Attempts to adopt Rita's fighting style and improves immediately, fighting well as a perfect team with her.
Turns to leave but is caught off guard by two more mimics and successfully dispatches them quickly.
Is stunned and momentarily confused by Rita's question, dropping his weapon.
No direct actions or statements present in the given excerpt to assess warmth.
Stands off to the side watching the fight instead of intervening or helping Rita to stop the conflict.
Standing in the throng, watching Rita instead of the fight.
Keeps staring at Rita seriously and asks to talk to her in private, showing persistence and focus.
Engages in a taxing iso-pushup challenge with Rita, demonstrating endurance and willingness to connect.
Keeps staring seriously and almost angrily at Rita during training; shows determination by holding the iso-pushup longer than all other soldiers and rivaling Rita's known endurance.
Quietly admits to Rita he needed sixteen tries to remember how to do the iso-pushup.
Pushes into the throng to call out to Rita, despite being overwhelmed and restrained by others.
Shares the deeply personal and incredible information about the loop and number of deaths with Rita openly.
Gives a violent look after being released, demanding answers impatiently.
Drops out of the struggle with a yell, seemingly giving up the position.
Recalls and reveals specific, detailed information (the number of times he has died and woken up) confidently under pressure, surprising others.
Pushes through a hostile crowd to confront Rita and demand answers, showing confident initiative.
Shows resilience by getting up after being pinned down and responding with determination.
Shows concern by asking Rita if she is OK after an emotional moment.
Attempts to connect by asking if Rita is 'in the loop' with him regarding the time loop experience.
Asks Rita questions about the loop and way out, showing curiosity and willingness to understand the situation.
Appears unsure or hesitant, seeking confirmation from Rita rather than taking decisive action.
Shares details about his death openly with Rita, showing sincerity and a willingness to be vulnerable.
Expresses desperation to understand the situation and help Rita, indicating concern and engagement.
Accurately describes the circumstances of his death and the mimic he killed, showing attention to detail and presence of mind despite trauma.
Expresses desperation and lack of understanding when confronted with the looping time phenomenon, asking Rita how it works.
Fails to see the pattern in the mimic battle movements when Rita asks him.
Asks sincere questions to understand his new situation and role, shows willingness to learn from Rita.
Expresses hope and relief about being free from the time loop, shares a moment of vulnerability with Rita.
Nods along despite confusion, indicating openness and trust in Rita’s explanation.
Asks insightful questions to understand how the time loop works and what his role in it is.
Acknowledges the difficulty of the mission with a hint of disbelief ('That's it? That sounds almost easy.') showing initial underestimation.
Nods despite his head swimming, implying he accepts complex information and is committed to the plan.
Helps up the drunk Yonaburu despite the latter's rough demeanor.
Reflects thoughtfully on Yonaburu's situation and fate, showing empathy.
Engages respectfully in conversation with Rita about saving her lieutenant.
Shows thoughtfulness and empathy by helping Yonaburu up despite his drunken state and reflecting on his situation.
Acknowledges and processes critical tactical information from Rita about enemy receivers, demonstrating attentive situational awareness.
Mobilizes troops and fights alongside Rita, coordinating attacks effectively and sharing compliments with her.
Shows off fighting moves for Rita, smiling and making eye contact.
Hurls himself at the antenna mimic with a battle cry to protect Rita, taking the risk to save her.
Suddenly kisses Rita after the battle, showing a sincere, affectionate gesture.
Hammers the last receivers, skillfully dodging and weaving, hacking down multiple enemies.
Hurls himself at the Antenna Mimic with a battle cry, destroying it efficiently and taking a low battle stance.
Brings down his axe with precise body movement to kill the last receiver after evading multiple attacks in slow motion.
Opens his faceplate and kisses Rita impulsively immediately after battle.
Suddenly staggers and experiences sharp skull pain, showing vulnerability or possible confusion.
Looks at Rita with horror and fear, showing vulnerability and trust in her presence.
Apologizes to Rita before dying, expressing regret and concern for her feelings.
Encourages Rita to get out of danger despite his own peril, showing selflessness and care.
Stares at a poster of Rita with tears, showing emotional sensitivity and attachment.
Fails to communicate clearly his pain and distress to others around him beyond brief cries, showing some internalization.
Calls Yonaburu by a friendly nickname 'Yobo' and compliments his idea.
Smiles after the nickname exchange, indicating friendliness.
Challenges and violently defeats multiple soldiers ('Dogs') without hesitation to reach Rita's tower.
Attempts to explain situation calmly to Rita and dogs despite injury and threat.
Respectfully salutes and requests private conversation with Sergeant-Major Vrataski.
Shows empathy by acknowledging Rita's loneliness ('I know').
Offers to spend peaceful time together, inviting Rita for breakfast.
Hesitates and lies about true motives to Rita.
Calmly communicates to Rita and the Dogs that he is in the time loop and gained important knowledge (killed an Antenna), convincing Rita to stop attacking him.
Requests permission to speak privately with Sergeant-Major Vrataski, showing respect for protocol despite unusual circumstances.
Hesitates and fabricates a story when asked why he is present, choosing not to reveal the full truth about the time loop.
Takes Rita's hand and pulls her to safety, running to lose the dogs and find the hole in the fence.
Shares a nervous and tender kiss with Rita, responding sincerely to her curiosity about it.
Admits openly that he was drafted and initially tried to get out of it, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Leads Rita by pulling her hand, quickly locating and escaping through a known hole in the fence, evading the Dogs.
Whispers a clear, direct command to follow him under tense circumstances.
Displays emotional vulnerability and admits to having tried everything to avoid the draft.
Engages in a tender and nervous kiss showing relational sensitivity rather than tactical skill.
Expresses sympathy for Rita's loss and sadness, apologizes sincerely.
Responds positively when Rita asks if he would kiss her again, showing openness and friendliness.
Appears uncertain or hesitant after hearing Rita's story, demonstrating thoughtful restraint rather than coldness or dismissiveness.
Shows empathy and attempts to comfort Rita with thoughtful, sincere responses despite emotional difficulty.
Expresses uncertainty and hesitation when confronted with deep emotional conversation.
Appreciates the beauty of Rita's holovid and compliments it sincerely.
Shows genuine interest and thanks when Rita pours him rare coffee, expressing appreciation.
Suggests to Rita that she show him how to make coffee sometime, indicating willingness to connect and learn from her.
Acknowledges and appreciates the quality of Rita's coffee, expressing interest to learn how to make it properly.
Sits up disoriented when waking in an unfamiliar place.
Tries to reassure Rita about their chances in the coming battle despite uncertainty.
Expresses concern and agrees with Rita about the danger, shares a moment of closeness before the attack.
Immediately follows Rita's suggestion and takes initiative to get to the armory, showing cooperation and trust.
Acknowledges the danger and decides to make a quick escape to the armory to get armor, showing situational awareness and initiative.
Initially stunned and disoriented after the javelin hits the tower, picks himself up showing resilience but not immediate composed action.
Thanks Yonaburu sincerely for saving his jacket and calls him 'buddy' and 'the best.'
Leads platoons bravely in battle against impossible odds.
Fights side-by-side with Rita, mirroring her moves seamlessly.
Kills multiple Mimic receivers mercilessly and unstoppably.
Sustains injuries but keeps fighting to protect Rita and accomplish the mission.
Relies on Rita's intervention to avoid death, showing teamwork and mutual reliance.
Fights alongside Rita, mirroring her moves perfectly, and kills multiple Mimic receivers in quick succession.
Engages the highly dangerous Antenna Mimic directly and fights back even as it uses his every move against him.
Gets knocked down and seriously wounded by the Antenna Mimic, nearly killed before being saved by Rita.
Blocks mimic's attacks to protect Rita, kills the mimic, then helps free her from the fallen dropship
Immediately checks on Rita's condition and helps her up
Engages in an urgent kiss with Rita after rescuing her
Blocks every strike from the powerful mimic and delivers the killing blow despite exhaustion.
Quickly assesses the situation after defeating the mimic and helps Rita by lifting the fallen dropship piece.
Shows concern for Rita's wellbeing immediately after battle and communicates clearly under pressure.
Admits to lying to be with Rita, expresses love sincerely.
Refuses to kill Rita despite knowing it's necessary for escape.
Questions Rita's sanity and resists her violent attacks.
Accepts the reality of the situation and attempts to defend himself against Rita, using his axe to parry her blows and backing away strategically.
Hesitates to kill Rita despite knowing it is necessary to end the loop, showing emotional conflict and indecision.
Attempts non-violent resolution first, refusing to fight Rita even though it endangers him, indicating lack of ruthless decisiveness.
Shows quick reflexes by rolling to avoid axe swings and kicking Rita away despite the tense situation.
Deflects blows and wards off Rita's attack, showing quick physical response.
Accidentally injures Rita during their struggle.
Immediately tries to help Rita and suggests escaping together after injuring her.
Despite injury and emotional distress, picks up the axe and charges into battle with a battle cry.
Keeps fighting long after the battle was over, despite exhaustion and grief.
Looks like the saddest person in the world at Rita's funeral, showing emotional vulnerability and sorrow.
Shows acceptance and respect for Yonaburu's gesture when he paints Cage's jacket bright blue.
Tosses Yonaburu a new medal with a smile, showing camaraderie and light confidence.
Steps cautiously into Rita's broken tower, paying attention to surroundings and warnings.

Calmly prepares coffee following instructions meticulously, indicating patience and attention to detail.
